text: Kang Kek Iew or Kaing Kek Iev, also romanized as Kaing Guek Eav (), nom de guerre Comrade Duch or Deuch (មិត្តឌុច); or Hang Pin, (17 November 1942 – 2 September 2020) was a Cambodian war criminal. He was leader in the Khmer Rouge movement, which ruled Democratic Kampuchea from 1975 to 1979. He was responsible for the Tuol Sleng (S-21) prison camp where thousands were held for interrogation and torture, after which many of these prisoners were eventually executed. Kek Iew died at the age of 77 at a hospital in Phnom Penh on 2 September 2020. The cause of death was lung disease.Duch, Prison Chief Who Slaughtered for the Khmer Rouge, Is Dead at 77 at The New York Times ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Communist Party of Kampuchea politicians Category:Asian military people Category:Deaths from lung disease
title: Kang Kek Iew
